required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of MSDx Complex 1 as a Marker for Therapy Response in Multiple Sclerosis
clinical_study.official_title: A Longitudinal Study of MSDx Complex 1 as a Marker for Therapy Response in Multiple Sclerosis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare biomarker levels in Multiple Sclerosis (MS) patients before and after beginning Natalizumab.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in MSDX Complex-1 between baseline and 6-month visit
primary_outcome.description: This outcome measure will evaluate a difference in the level of MSDX Complex-1 form the baseline visit to the 6-month visit. MSDX Complex-1 is a biomarker for MS disease activity and its change should correspond with a change in the disease activity in MS.

secondary_outcome.measure: Gadolinium MRI and MSDX Complex-1 level
secondary_outcome.description: This outcome will evaluate whether a change seen in a Gadolinium MRI (a diagnostic test for MS) matches with a change in the MSDX Complex-1 level in a patient with MS.

arm_group.description: Patients with a diagnosis of relapsing remitting multiple sclerosis (RRMS) who is about to begin Natalizumab (Tysabri) therapy for a relapse in clinical symptoms (either diagnosed clinically or via gadolinium MRI).

biospec_descr.textblock: Blood remaining after the biomarker test is completed will be retained for possible evaluation of additional biomarkers

study_pop.textblock: The study populations for this study is a patient with a diagnosis of relapsing remitting multiple sclerosis (RRMS) who is about to begin Natalizumab (Tysabri) therapy for a relapse in clinical symptoms (either diagnosed clinically or via gadolinium MRI).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Diagnosis of clinically definite relapsing remitting MS (RRMS)
2. Age 45 years and older
3. Willing and able to provide written informed consent
4. Patient has high disease activity.
5. Patient is about to begin Natalizumab (Tysabri) therapy.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Any clinically significant disease other than MS that is likely to interfere with the evaluation of CDMS
2. Known infectious or hematological disease.
3. Unwilling or unable to comply with the requirements of this protocol
4. Subject can not have a gadolinium enhanced MRI
